item.title: Ticket #7830 (Attachment.php and Image.php aren't working in several themes) created
item.dc:creator: langsuyar
item.description:
I made a copy of index.php, renamed it to attachment.php. The template is used correctly when clicking on a gallery entry - but it doesn't display the image in the attachment! Weird.

The code is identical to index.php (which works), and both do a standard the_content() call. When comparing the HTML that index.php and the (theoretically identical) attachment.php generate, the latter one doesn't contain any references to my image.

Broken in Revolution Business Pro Theme, but I've gotten it to break in other themes as well (Vanilla Mist, for example). Kubrik works, on the other hand!

Please see â€‹http://wordpress.org/support/topic/200462 for full thread on the problem.

fixed:

include( get_query_template('searchform') )

I don't think abstracting include in another function is a good idea because of the additional overhead.

item.title: Ticket #7771 (XMLRPC api stripping leading angle brackets) updated
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description:
I wonder if this is specific to the libxml version then. Here's the details on what I tested against: 

PHP - 5.2.6
libxml - 2.6.16
dom/xml api version - 20031129

So perhaps there's something different about libxml 2.7.x that is causing the problems?

item.title: Ticket #7829 (logout from anywhere except meta on the site fails) updated
item.dc:creator: DD32
item.description:
Priority, Severity changed

The logout link on 2.7 is covered by a nonce now.

If a plugin doesnt implement the functionality at present, It'll need to be updated to comply.

It appears that themes will currently need to be fixed up to support the new logout link functions (which include the nonce).

See #7790

item.title: Ticket #7829 (logout from anywhere except meta on the site fails) updated
item.dc:creator: surispace
item.description: oops i meant 3rd october 2008

item.title: Ticket #7829 (logout from anywhere except meta on the site fails) created
item.dc:creator: surispace
item.description:
it seems like there is a problem with logging out in 2.7 latest build as on 3/sept/2008.

if trying to logout from meta menu, the log out works. however if logging out from either above the "reply/leave a comment" box or otherwise via a AJax login pluggin, logout fails.

there seems to be a call made to action wpnonce under the meta menu for logout button but not anywhere else in the site.

kindly look into it. fix it ASAP.

item.title: Ticket #7745 (Private posts cannot have unpublished or pending review status) updated
item.dc:creator: miahz
item.description:
There needs to be some clarification in the UI wording and the functionality of post publish status vs. privacy status.

Some discussion here: â€‹http://wordpress.org/support/topic/197051?replies=6#post-867823

If i make a new post, check 'Keep this post private' with the Publish Status left as Unpublished, then click the Save button, why does the status become Published? I didn't click the Publish button.

To me, a draft/unpublished post is a different concept from a private post. I would think that i could have a private post saved as a draft. When i finished writing, i could publish it, but it would be visible in the front end only to me.

Otherwise, if the functionality remains as is, the 'keep private' option needs to be moved to the Publish Status dropdown menu, because truly it's a publish state. It doesn't make sense as a separate option.

item.title: Ticket #7828 (Dashboard menu item shifts the menu) created

item.description: When viewing the dashboard, the admin menu shifts down a few pixels. This doesn't happen with any other menus. I think it has to do with the Dashboard not having any children.
